A Product_specification is a type of that characterizes a product or a set of products in a by a set of Specifications. A Product_specification identifies a manufacturable object, or expected as so.

The kind of product that is to be manufactured from the data of the Product_specification, is the kind of product that the item_context attribute identifies a class of.
The intent of the Product_specification entity is the identification of one manufacturable object whereas the intent of Product_class is the gathering of products with similar characteristics.
The actual set of Specification instances for a Product_specification are obtained by the union of the Specification instances grouped in the defining_specification attribute and of the Specification instances related to the considered through a or a with association_type 'identification'.

For these Specification_category objects, any Specification available in the context of the considered Product_class is considered as valid for the manufacturing of the product characterized by the considered Product_specification.
If the colour is not specified for a given product family, the specified product resulting from the realization of a Product_specification associated to the Product_class representing the product family may be without paint or painted in any available colour.

The version_id specifies the version identifier of the Product_specification.

A Specification_based_product_version is a type of Product_version that is defined by a Product_specification. The entity Specification_based_product_version may be instantiated jointly with other subtypes of Product_version.
Depending on the specialization of Product_version, a Specification_based_product_version may identify a part version that provides the design of a manufactured product, a document version that is a realization of a document product or a function version.
The Product_specification provides the set of specifications from which the product version shall be designed or manufactured.
A brochure editor may offer to his customers various brochure types with variable paper quality, coloring, layout. These concepts can be represented with instances of the entities defined in the product_class module. Thus, an instance of Specification_based_product_version may identify a document version that is the realization of a particular kind of brochure with a particular selection of paper and layout.
The Item_design_association that provides the specification of the Product_version.
The Specification_based_product_version shall identify a realization of a Product_specification.
